mention.text: A lie detector that measures brain waves
J. Peter Rosenfeld , a Northwestern University professor of psychology and of neurobiology and physiology
a Northwestern University professor of psychology and of neurobiology and physiology
what consumers want instead of what they say they want
the detector for almost four years
a perfectly valid way of detecting lies
a professor of neurology at New York University College of Medicine in New York City and editor of the Danbury , Conn.-based neuroscience journal
